preface.title: About This Guide
preface.para: &smtool; (⪪) for &sle; 11 helps customers to manage their &sle; software updates while maintaining corporate firewall policy and regulatory compliance requirements. ⪪ is a package proxy system that is integrated with the NovellÂ® Customer Center and provides key &ncc; capabilities locally at the customer site. It provides a repository and registration target that is synchronized with the &ncc;, thus maintaining all the capabilities of the &ncc; while allowing a more secure centralized deployment.

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: The &smtguide; is divided into the following chapters:

listitem.para: This chapter introduces the ⪪ installation process and the SMT Configuration Wizard. You can install the ⪪ add-on together with your base system during the installation process or on top of an already installed base system. The ⪪ Configuration Wizard guides you through the individual installation steps.

This chapter introduces the &yast; configuration module ⪪ Server. You can set and configure organization credentials, ⪪ database passwords, and e-mail addresses to send ⪪ reports, or set the ⪪ job schedule, and activate or deactivate the ⪪ service.
This chapter introduces the option to mirror the installation and update sources with &yast;.
This chapter introduces the option to register client machines on &ncc;. The Client machines must be configured to use ⪪.

This chapter introduces generated reports based on ⪪ and &ncc; data. Generated reports contain statistics of all registered machines and products used and of all active, expiring, or missing subscriptions.
This chapter introduces the most important scripts, configuration files and certificates shipped with ⪪.

This chapter introduces the option to configure any client machine to register against ⪪ and download software updates from there instead of communicating directly with the Novell Customer Center and the NU servers.
